blocks.text: In this case the numerator is of the first degree in $x$, whilst the denominator is of the second degree. Also we notice that the derivative of the denominator is $2x$ and the numerator is $18(4x^5)$. The derivative of the denominator and the numerator are consequently related. Hence the substitution will be of the form:

blocks.latex: u = x^2 + 16\quad \text{so that } du = 2x \, dx \quad \text{and thus } dx = \frac{du}{2x}.
blocks.description: Substitution for integral with respect to variable u.
Final result of the integral evaluation.

blocks.text: This is evidently of the type \textit{f(x) + g(x)}, where f and g are functions of x. We can split the integral accordingly.
